intro: Nasturtium lanatum, commonly known as the hairy nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy orange or red flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically borne on slender stalks and are accompanied by heart-shaped, wavy-edged leaves. Nasturtium lanatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
